text.content: Welcome to the Emergent Literacy module.

This module is designed to help you:
  • Understand the importance of the preschool years in the development of literacy skills
  • Provide parents with the information they need to promote healthy language and literacy development in day-to-day activities
Emergent literacy is also sometimes referred to as pre-literacy or early literacy.

Educator Training Goals:

Provide research findings that define and explain the importance of early or emergent literacy.

Describe how early experiences prepare children for reading and writing.

Explain why young childrenâ€™s relationships with the significant adults in their lives, including parents and caregivers, are essential in fostering literacy skills.

Provide simple, yet effective, ways parents can prepare children to read and write.

graphic.notes: Reyes_Read from Communication pillar in Pre-literacy folder (Hispanic family reading)

audio.transcript: Welcome to the Emergent Literacy module.

This module is designed to help you understand the importance of the preschool years in the development of literacy skills, and to provide parents with the information they need to promote healthy language and literacy development in day-to-day activities
Emergent literacy is also sometimes referred to as pre-literacy or early literacy. Emergent literacy is used throughout this module for consistency.

By the end of this module, you should be able to: 1) Provide research findings that define and explain the importance of early or emergent literacy. 2) Describe how early experiences prepare children for reading and writing. 3) Explain why young children's relationships with the significant adults in their lives, including parents and caregivers, are essential in fostering literacy skills. And 4) Provide simple, yet effective, ways parents can prepare children to read and write.
